## Type of Change

<!-- Check the box that applies -->

- [ ] `fix`: Bug fix
- [ ] `safety`: Security or robustness fix
- [ ] `validation`: Input validation or error handling improvement
- [ ] `refactor`: Code restructuring without behavior change
- [ ] `structure`: Architecture or responsibility changes
- [ ] `tooling`: Development tools or CI/CD updates
- [ ] `policy`: Governance or process documentation
- [ ] `docs`: Documentation only
- [ ] `visuals`: Formatting or readability (no logic changes)
- [ ] `chore`: Maintenance tasks

## Testing

<!-- Describe how you tested these changes -->

- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] Integration tests pass
- [ ] Manual testing performed
- [ ] Linting passes (`ruff check`, `black --check`)
- [ ] Type checking passes (`mypy`)

## Checklist

- [ ] Code follows Python-first principle
- [ ] Commits are atomic (one logical change each)
- [ ] Commit messages follow convention
- [ ] Tests added for new functionality
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] No breaking changes (or justified and documented)
